dc:title:
House of Hospitality,
Chapter Nine
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: A summer full of trips between the Easton farm and the city, she vividly chronicles the flurry of activity that seemingly accomplishes a great deal. Struggles with issues of freedom, personal responsibility, and her role in the movement. Feels "utterly lacking, ineffective."
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 444 1939-02-10 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
